property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.LOG_LEVEL
property.description: Specifies an integer value for logging media related information. Default is 3. 16 is the maximum. Higher values mean to log more information.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.AUDIO_PORT
property.description: Specifies an integer value for the data port. This is useful if you are behind a firewall and have to open up ports. Default is dynamic port number.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.SWAP_SPEAKER_CHANNELS
property.description: If set to true, left and right speaker channels will be swapped.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.SPEAKER_BUFFER_SIZE
property.description: This is the number of milliseconds of data which the speaker can buffer. Values will be rounded up to 20ms boundaries. Smaller values mean lower latency but also run the risk of overflow if there's is burst of data. The default value is 160ms.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.FLUSH_SPEAKER_WHEN_FULL
property.description: When data needs to be written to the speaker and there isn't enough room to write the data, flush the speaker before before writing. Default is false.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.PREVENT_SPEAKER_UNDERRUN
property.description: When set to true, a thread writes silence to the speaker when the speaker buffer is near empty.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.MIN_JITTER_BUFFER_SIZE
property.description: Add at least this many packets of latency to smooth out jitter. The actual jitter buffer size is determined dynamically. This parameter sets the minimum value.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.MAX_JITTER_BUFFER_SIZE
property.description: Add up to this many packets of latency to smooth out jitter. The actual jitter buffer size is determined dynamically. This parameter limits the size.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.USE_EXTERNAL_MIC
property.description: When set to true, the last mixer will be selected for the microphone on the Mac.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.MICROPHONE_BUFFER_SIZE
property.description: This is the number of milliseconds of data which the microphone can buffer. Values will be rounded up to 20ms boundaries. Smaller values mean lower latency but also run the risk of overflow if the softphone is unable to read the microphone fast enough. default value is 40ms. It is unlikely you will need to change this.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.ADJUST_MICROPHONE_BIAS
property.description: We have encountered a microphone with a DC bias. This causes static to be heard. If this parameter is set to true, an attempt will be made to figure out the bias and adjust for it. Default is false.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.SMOOTH_MICROPHONE
property.description: When set to true, an attempt is made to smooth out microphone reads so that only one read is done every 20 ms. This is intended for debugging. Default is false.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.SPEAKER_BIAS
property.description: Adjust samples written to the speaker by adding this value. For Debugging!

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.RECEIVE_COMFORT_PAYLOAD
property.description: When set to true, if a comfort noise payload is received, comfort noise will be generated.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.SEND_COMFORT_PAYLOAD
property.description: When set to true, a comfort noise payload is sent when silence is detected.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.COMFORT_NOISE_LEVEL
property.description: Specifies the comfort noise level used with a Comfort Payload. Default is 62. Range is 0 - 127 with smaller numbers meaning louder comfort noise.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.VERIFY_SENDER
property.description: When using the same audio port number for different sessions, it's possible that an old audio source is still sending data. When this flag is set to true, old data will be rejected. Default is true.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.FLUSH_SOCKET
property.description: When set to any String, causes the RTP socket to be flushed. This automatically resets to an empty String.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.VOLUME_THRESHOLD
property.description: Used to tune the detection of sound for determining when to send a comfort payload. Default value is 100.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.MIN_THRESHOLD_COUNT
property.description: Used to tune the detection of sound for determining when to send a comfort payload. Default value is 50.

property.name: com.sun.mc.stun.LOCAL_IP_ADDRESS
property.description: This is the IP to use for network traffic. If this is blank, system will try to find a suitable address which is reachable. If you specify an address here and it is not reachable as determined by InetAddress isReachable(), a warning message will be displayed but the address will be used anyway.

property.name: com.sun.mc.stun.NETWORK_INTERFACE_TIMEOUT
property.description: This is the timeout value in milliseconds used by InetAddress.isReachable() to determine if an address is reachable. The default is 100ms and it is unlikely that you will need to change this.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.SPEEX_ENABLED
property.description: Set to true to enable Speex encoding. Default is false. Note that decoding of received packets is always enabled so that the sender can enable or disable Speex encoding without restarting a call.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.SPEEX_QUALITY
property.description: If Speex is enabled, this is the Speex Encoding Quality. Values range from 0 to 10, default is 0.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.media.SPEEX_COMPLEXITY
property.description: If Speex is enabled, this is the Speex Encoding Complexity. Values range from 0 to 10, default is 0.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.sip.USER_NAME
property.description: The name the Sip Communicator will use as part of the SIP phone address.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.sip.PREFERRED_LOCAL_PORT
property.description: The port where Sip Communicator should listen for incoming SIP messages. If it fails to bind to that port Sip Communicator will randomly bind to another one.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.sip.REGISTRAR_ADDRESS
property.description: The address of your registrar server (if any).

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.sip.REGISTRAR_UDP_PORT
property.description: The port where the registrar server is listening.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.sip.REGISTRAR_TRANSPORT
property.description: The transport protocol that should be used when contacting the registrar server.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.sip.WAIT_UNREGISTGRATION_FOR
property.description: The time that registrations with the registrar server will remain valid. Sip Communicator automatically renews registration after the time has expired (default is 3600).

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.sip.DOMAIN_NAME
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.sip.AUTHENTICATION_USER_NAME
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.sip.DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATION_REALM
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.AUTOANSWER_DELAY
property.description: If this is set to non-zero, when a call is received, it will be autoanswered after the speicifed milliseconds have elapsed.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.USE_TELEPHONE_EVENT_PAYLOAD
property.description: If this is set to true, an attempt will be made to negotiate a telephone event payload with the remote side.

property.name: com.sun.mc.softphone.sip.SESSION_PROGRESS_IS_OK
property.description: If this is set to true, SESSION_PROGRESS will be treated as OK. This is a workaround to a problem where our PBX never sends a connect message to the VoIP gateway. Default is true.

property.name: javax.sip.OUTBOUND_PROXY_ADDRESS
property.description: Fill this in if you are using a SIP proxy server. IMPORTANT! Format is <font color="blue">&#60address>:&#60port>/&#60transport> </font>. Where <font color="blue">&#60address></font> is the IP address or FQDN of the proxy server. <font color="blue">&#60port></font> is its port and <font color="blue">&#60transport></font> is the protocol that it uses, tcp or udp.

property.name: gov.nist.javax.sip.TRACE_LEVEL
property.description: Trace level indicates the stack the level of logging. 32 logs everything and 1 for weakest logging.

property.name: gov.nist.javax.sip.SERVER_LOG
property.description: The name of the file where the stack should store its log messages.

property.name: log4j.rootLogger
property.description: Needed by Log4J

property.name: log4j.appender.RFLogger
property.description: Needed by Log4J

property.name: log4j.appender.RFLogger.File
property.description: Log file name.

property.name: log4j.appender.RFLogger.MaxFileSize
property.description: The maximum allowable size of the log file.

property.name: log4j.appender.RFLogger.MaxBackupIndex
property.description: Number of log files to keep in backup.

property.name: log4j.appender.RFLogger.layout
property.description: The layout to used when logging messages.

property.name: log4j.appender.RFLogger.layout.ConversionPattern
property.description: Conversion pattern. Needed by Log4J
